xwikidoc.content: <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 07:18 <BogdanVancea1_> has joined #ccm 07:18 <BogdanVancea1_> hello everyone 07:36 <sdumitriu> Hi 07:38 <BogdanVancea1_> did you manage to take a look on my pull request? 07:39 <sdumitriu> Sorry, no 07:39 <BogdanVancea1_> ah, ok then :) 07:39 <sdumitriu> After dinner I had to fill in some paperwork, which took until midnight :( 07:39 <sdumitriu> And it's still not over 07:39 <BogdanVancea1_> ouch 07:39 <BogdanVancea1_> its ok 07:39 <sdumitriu> I don't like paperwork... 07:39 <BogdanVancea1_> I need to finish a paper 07:40 <BogdanVancea1_> so I've got some work aswell 07:40 <BogdanVancea1_> gsoc related paperwork? 07:40 <sdumitriu> No 07:44 <BogdanVancea1_> I see 07:44 <BogdanVancea1_> well, good luck with it :) 07:44 <BogdanVancea1_> we can talk when you're not as busy 07:44 <BogdanVancea1_> :) 10:34 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 10:48 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 11:18 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 11:21 <ravigarg27_> hey sdumitriu1 11:21 <ravigarg27_> free? 11:21 <sdumitriu1> Hey 11:21 <sdumitriu1> Not really 11:21 <sdumitriu1> But I got time for you 11:22 <ravigarg27_> hehe ok I will be quick I have written code for calculating distance between the terms 11:23 <ravigarg27_> I also went through the suggest code files you suggested 11:23 <ravigarg27_> understood quite a bit 11:25 <ravigarg27_> but was not able to understand the structure of json reply from the request send 11:25 <ravigarg27_> as in where are the synonyms stored 11:32 <sdumitriu1> Did you use Firebug to capture the response? 11:32 <sdumitriu1> Or how did you look at the JSON? 11:34 <ravigarg27_> I couldn't look at JSON response actually 11:36 <kushalkhandelwal> install firebug in firefox 11:36 <ravigarg27_> installed 11:36 <kushalkhandelwal> gr8 11:36 <kushalkhandelwal> open it 11:37 <sdumitriu1> Make sure the Net tab is activated 11:37 <ravigarg27_> ok done 11:37 <sdumitriu1> Then when you search for something, you should see the request 11:37 <sdumitriu1> And it should have a JSON subtab 11:39 <kushalkhandelwal> ravigarg27_, tried it ? 11:39 <ravigarg27_> yup doing thanx 11:40 <kushalkhandelwal> ok :) 11:40 <ravigarg27_> I meant thanx sdumitriu :P 11:41 <kushalkhandelwal> :P 11:41 <sdumitriu1> thanx kushalkhandelwal as well 11:41 <kushalkhandelwal> Ha its ok :) 11:41 <kushalkhandelwal> Paper work today ? sdumitriu1 11:42 <sdumitriu1> No, sysadmin work today... 11:42 <sdumitriu1> Done with the paperwork 11:42 <kushalkhandelwal> Ahh 11:42 <kushalkhandelwal> What kind of work ? 11:42 <kushalkhandelwal> You got the new machine ? 11:43 <kushalkhandelwal> for CI ? 11:43 <sdumitriu1> Almost 11:43 <sdumitriu1> I need to get login on the machine, but at least the machine is ready 11:43 <sdumitriu1> Actually two of them 11:43 <kushalkhandelwal> Oh nice 11:43 <kushalkhandelwal> Wohoo 11:43 <kushalkhandelwal> So faster builds 11:43 <ravigarg27_> thanx kushalkhandelwal 11:44 <kushalkhandelwal> Using machine for other work ? 11:44 <kushalkhandelwal> ravigarg27_, No problem :) 11:45 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu1, Do you use puppet ? 11:45 <sdumitriu1> Nope, not yet 11:46 <kushalkhandelwal> learning about it 11:46 <sdumitriu1> No need for it so far since I only had one machine 11:46 <sdumitriu1> But yes, it's a good tool for the future 11:46 <kushalkhandelwal> I am looking how I can automate machines at server room in my campus 11:46 <kushalkhandelwal> Yes it is 11:46 <kushalkhandelwal> I am working within fedora community 11:46 <kushalkhandelwal> Taking some helpful tips from there 11:47 <kushalkhandelwal> You are busy today 11:48 <kushalkhandelwal> When you get time a discussion on puppet and chef 11:48 <kushalkhandelwal> One more of random discussions with you :) 12:48 <gustavojordan> has joined #ccm 14:57 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 15:27 <ravigarg27> hey sdumitriu1 15:27 <sdumitriu1> Hey 15:33 <ravigarg27> I have pasted the updated code over here http://pastebin.com/S6tG8YJc new added starts from line number 466 I am still a begineer in JavaScript so was finding it difficult to debug it 15:33 <ravigarg27> can you please have a look 15:34 <ravigarg27> and please do pardon me if you find this too noobish 15:40 <sdumitriu1> minimator: I'd change the conditions to <= instead of < 15:41 <ravigarg27> ok will do that 15:43 <sdumitriu1> You're always setting a synonym 15:43 <sdumitriu1> matchSynonym = synonym[0]; -> should be inside the if after it 15:44 <sdumitriu1> Another thing that I didn't mention: this should also work when the user only typed a prefix 15:44 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 15:44 <sdumitriu1> So if I type "mental", it should highlight the "mental retardation" synonym 15:45 <sdumitriu1> But if I type "Intellectual", it correctly matches "Intellectual disability" better than other synonyms 15:46 <sdumitriu1> So, instead of computing the distance to the full m and n lengths, it should only compute the distance up to [n, min(m, n)] 15:47 <ravigarg27> ohh okay 15:47 <sdumitriu1> Also, you should check that the matched synonym doesn't have a worse score than the name itself 15:47 <sdumitriu1> But you're going in the right direction 15:47 <sdumitriu1> This looks good 15:48 <ravigarg27> is the processing of synonyms correct 15:48 <sdumitriu1> Yes, looks good 15:49 <sdumitriu1> Did you try it? Does it work? 15:49 <ravigarg27> Yeah I tried it; but sadly it didnt work 15:49 <ravigarg27> actually whole autosuggest didnt came up 15:50 <sdumitriu1> Hm... Might be a syntax error someplace 15:50 <sdumitriu1> Firebug can help again 15:50 <sdumitriu1> If it's a syntax error, it should print something in the Console tab 15:51 <ravigarg27> okay i am trying that 16:05 <ravigarg27_> has joined #ccm 16:31 <sdumitriu2> has joined #ccm 16:51 <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm 16:52 <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm 20:44 <marta> has joined #ccm 23:28 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm
